trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Aarner is staring mournfully over the railing.
TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_TODO_00<tab>Collect tearstained letters in the Derelicts.
TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_TODO_01<tab>Deliver the tearstained letters to Aarner near the Grand Dame's Parlor.
TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_AARNER_000_000<tab>My letters! Scattered by the winds! Whose idea was it to build this city with so many breezy walkways?

TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_AARNER_000_001<tab><sigh> No. In this, too, I have no one to blame but myself. They are important to me, though, so might I ask you to search for them? There are three, all told. They likely came to rest in the Derelicts, as these things tend to.
TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_AARNER_000_002<tab>I would fetch the letters myself, but I'm meant to be meeting someone here, and I don't believe I could stand to disappoint yet another person.
TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_AARNER_000_010<tab>Ah, there you are. Did you have any luck?
TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_AARNER_000_011<tab>You found all three! Wonderful! I cannot possibly express how difficult it would have been for me to rewrite them.
TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_AARNER_000_012<tab>Wait... Now I've had a good look at you─are you perchance one of those responsible for freeing us from Vauthry's influence?
TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_AARNER_000_013<tab>I thought as much. You have my thanks, for opening my eyes.

TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_AARNER_000_014<tab>I used to reside in the Crystarium, you know. But the moment that I saw for myself what happens when the eaters take a person... I truly understood, for the first time, that our world teeters on the brink of destruction. I was terrified.

TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_AARNER_000_015<tab>I knew I could do nothing to change fate. So I came to Eulmore, hoping to forget it instead. Abandoned my work, my family...everything. And I felt no guilt for it, convinced as I was that nothing mattered.

TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_AARNER_000_016<tab>Now, though, the scales have fallen from my eyes. I've always been a coward, and what I did was a betrayal of the highest order. And I know...I know there's no going back.

TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_AARNER_000_017<tab>If nothing else, however, I can apologize for what I've done. So I labored over these letters, hoping to convey my contrition. I don't expect forgiveness, but I hope it might mean something, at least, to those I left behind.

TEXT_LUCKZH009_03519_AARNER_000_018<tab>I cannot alter what has been done, but I can change myself. Try to be better. And you will always have my gratitude for giving me the ability to see that─you and your elven friend, both. Thank you.
